Key Match Events: DeMar DeRozan scored nine of his game-high 30 points in the second overtime, helping the Sacramento Kings outlast the Miami Heat 123-118.
Domantas Sabonis recorded a triple-double with 21 points, 18 rebounds, and 11 assists, along with three blocks.
Keon Ellis had 17 points and Keegan Murray added 14 for the Kings.
Murray also had 12 rebounds and Ellis grabbed eight boards and three steals.
Malik Monk finished with 23 points and Jalen Johnson contributed 10 points for the Kings.
Tyler Herro led the Heat with 26 points, while Bam Adebayo and Terry Rozier each contributed 18 points.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. had a triple-double with 16 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists, and also had five steals.
Haywood Highsmith posted 14 points and Nikola Jovic totaled 12 for the Heat.
Neither team scored in the final 50 seconds of regulation, and the game went to two overtimes.
Post-Match Reflections: DeMar DeRozan's performance was crucial in the Kings' win.
Domantas Sabonis played exceptionally well with a triple-double.
Keon Ellis and Keegan Murray provided significant contributions to the Kings' victory.
